dublinCore.dc:title: 114 S68 IS: Voter Integrity Protection Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Vitter introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to make voting in a Federal election by an unlawfully present alien an aggravated felony and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Voter Integrity Protection Act.

subsection.text: Paragraph (43) of section 101(a) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1101(a)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (T), by striking and at the end;
in subparagraph (U), by striking the period at the end and inserting a semicolon and and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: an offense described in section 611 of title 18, United States Code, committed by an alien who is unlawfully present in the United States.

subsection.text: Paragraph (2) of section 237(a) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1227(a)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: Any alien who is unlawfully present in the United States and who knowingly commits a violation of section 611 of title 18, United States Code.
